JMB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on November 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:24 PM Defendant Joseph L Harvey in court.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis appeared by video for Joseph L Harvey.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Davis relates and moves for bond modification.  State objects. Court relates she is not familiar with this case, but will reset before Judge Bitney.  Parties may appear by Zoom Video. Bond continues.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Defense corrected motion to modify bond.
Motion to modify bond (to lift no contact)
Telephone scheduling conference on November 11, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Order granting continuance.
Order granting continuance
Motion for Continuance of jury trial.

10:11 AM Defendant Joseph L Harvey in court.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis in court for Joseph L Harvey.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Davis relates case has not yet been resolved and requests trial date. Jury Trial set for February 15, 2023 at 8:00 AM. Proposed Jury Instructions, Witness Lists, Verdict Forms, any Motions and Notice of Intent to Use Video are to be filed no later than 2/8/2023.
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Notice from Embrace to drop the no-contact condition on the bond.

1:30 PM Defendant Joseph L Harvey in court.   Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nicholas Von Davis not in court. 
Court relates. 
Court enters a NG plea on Defendant's behalf and preserves all his pre arraignment rights.
Bond to continue.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
granting remote appearance.
Order granting remote appearance
Motion for Remote Appearance
Arraignment on September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:14 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph L Harvey in court.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis appeared by video for Joseph L Harvey. 

9:15  Court relates and gives appearances.
9:15  Atty. Davis indicates defendant wishes to waive right to preliminary hearing.
9:16  Court question Mr. Harvey; Mr. Harvey indicates he wishes to waive right to preliminary hearing; Court accepts waiver.
9:17  Court finds probable cause; bound over.
Arraignment set; must appear in person with attorney.
Bond to continue.
Arraignment scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

for zoom appearance.

Formal reading of complaint waived. Set for preliminary hearing. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. Must appear in person.

10:47 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph L Harvey appeared by video. 

Attorney Steurer appeared by zoom video.  An attorney has not been found yet.  

Court finds good cause to adjourn,
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Must have no contact with M. B.
